greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of solutions to x^8 + y^8 = z^8 mod n.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: Table[cnt=0; Do[If[Mod[x^8 + y^8 - z^8, n]==0, cnt++], {x, 0, n-1}, {y, 0, n-1}, {z, 0, n-1}]; cnt, {n, 50}] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jul 18 2018 *)
program: (PARI) a(n)={my(p=Mod(sum(i=0, n-1, x^lift(Mod(i,n)^8)), 1-x^n)); vecsum(Vec( serconvol(lift(p^2) + O(x^n), lift(p) + O(x^n))))} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 17 2018
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Jun 05 2017
